cdf12:Benchmark.cdf12:title: Cimcor Windows CimTrak Agent Operational Status

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: This benchmark verifies the operational status of CimTrak agents on Windows systems including Windows Server 2019, Windows Server 2022, Windows 10, and Windows 11. It focuses on agent installation, configuration validation, and service monitoring to ensure proper file integrity monitoring capabilities.

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: This profile performs comprehensive agent validation including service status and configuration
Includes both Windows service monitoring and configuration file validation
Ensures complete operational readiness of the CimTrak agent

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: Verification of CimTrak agent Windows service status, including service state and operational readiness

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Ensure CimTrakAgent service is enabled and running

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The CimTrakAgent Windows service provides real-time file integrity monitoring, detecting changes to critical system files, configurations, and directories. Unlike Windows File Resource Manager (FSRM) which operates on scheduled scans, CimTrak continuously monitors the file system and can instantly alert on or remediate unauthorized changes.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: File integrity monitoring is essential for:

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: Meeting compliance requirements (PCI-DSS, HIPAA, SOX, NERC, FISMA, GDPR, CMMC)
Preventing zero-day attacks through change prevention
Providing forensic information (who, what, when, how) for security incidents

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: CimTrak is an acceptable replacement for native Windows file monitoring because it provides comprehensive real-time monitoring, automated remediation, change prevention, and enterprise management features.

xhtml:ol.xhtml:li:
Download the appropriate installer:
Windows x64: ctagent_e_setup_windows_x64_*.exe
Windows x86: ctagent_e_setup_windows_x86_*.exe

Run the installer with required parameters (using Command Prompt as Administrator):
ctagent_e_setup_windows_x64_*.exe /S /REPOSITORY=[REPOSITORY_IP] /PORT=3749 /USER=[USERNAME] /PASSWORD=[PASSWORD] /AGENTNAME=[UNIQUE_NAME]

Alternatively, use an install key:
ctagent_e_setup_windows_x64_*.exe /S /REPOSITORY=[REPOSITORY_IP] /PORT=3749 /INSTALLKEY=[KEY] /AGENTNAME=[UNIQUE_NAME]

xhtml:p.xhtml:b: If already installed, enable and start the service using PowerShell (as Administrator):

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: Verification of CimTrak agent configuration files, parameters, and connectivity settings in Windows environment
This rule ensures CimTrak Agent configuration maintains secure operational parameters and proper authentication mechanisms by executing the built-in configuration validation command.

The CimTrakAgent.exe --checkinstall command performs comprehensive validation of the agent configuration including repository connectivity, authentication credentials, and operational readiness checks.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: A properly configured CimTrakAgent is essential for:

xhtml:ul.xhtml:li: Establishing secure communication with the CimTrak repository
Ensuring proper file system monitoring capabilities are available
Providing unique agent identification for centralized management
Enabling real-time change detection and reporting

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Without proper configuration, the CimTrakAgent cannot function effectively, leaving systems vulnerable to undetected changes and compliance violations.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure CimTrakAgent service is enabled and active
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Verify that the CimTrakAgent Windows service is both enabled for auto-start and currently active/running

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure CimTrakAgent is properly configured
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Verify that CimTrakAgent --checkinstall command returns success, confirming proper configuration and connectivity

win-def:wmi57_object.comment: CimTrak Agent service properties for status checking
win-def:wmi57_object.win-def:wql: SELECT Name, State, StartMode, PathName FROM Win32_Service WHERE Name = 'CimTrak Agent'

x-cmd-def:shellcommand_object.x-cmd-def:command: for /f "tokens=*" %i in ('wmic service where "name='CimTrak Agent'" get pathname /value ^| findstr "="') do set %i && if defined PathName call %PathName% --checkinstall

win-def:wmi57_state.comment: Service is set to automatic startup

oval-sc:object.comment: CimTrak Agent service properties for status checking

win-sc:wmi57_item.win-sc:wql: SELECT Name, State, StartMode, PathName FROM Win32_Service WHERE Name = 'CimTrak Agent'

x-cmd-sc:shellcommand_item.x-cmd-sc:command: for /f "tokens=*" %i in ('wmic service where "name='CimTrak Agent'" get pathname /value ^| findstr "="') do set %i && if defined PathName call %PathName% --checkinstall
